description: Gets a summary of all CodePipeline action types associated with your account.

nested_items.name: actionTypes
nested_items.description: Provides details of the action types.

nested_items.name: category
nested_items.description: A category defines what kind of action can be taken in the stage, and constrains the provider type for the action. Valid categories are limited to one of the following values.
Source.
Build.
Test.
Deploy.
Invoke.
Approval.
Compute.

nested_items.name: owner
nested_items.description: The creator of the action being called. There are three valid values for the Owner field in the action category section within your pipeline structure: AWS, ThirdParty, and Custom. For more information, see Valid Action Types and Providers in CodePipeline.

nested_items.name: provider
nested_items.description: The provider of the service being called by the action. Valid providers are determined by the action category. For example, an action in the Deploy category type might have a provider of CodeDeploy, which would be specified as CodeDeploy. For more information, see Valid Action Types and Providers in CodePipeline.

nested_items.name: version
nested_items.description: A string that describes the action version.

nested_items.name: thirdPartyConfigurationUrl
nested_items.description: The URL of a sign-up page where users can sign up for an external service and perform initial configuration of the action provided by that service.

nested_items.name: entityUrlTemplate
nested_items.description: The URL returned to the CodePipeline console that provides a deep link to the resources of the external system, such as the configuration page for a CodeDeploy deployment group. This link is provided as part of the action display in the pipeline.

nested_items.name: executionUrlTemplate
nested_items.description: The URL returned to the CodePipeline console that contains a link to the top-level landing page for the external system, such as the console page for CodeDeploy. This link is shown on the pipeline view page in the CodePipeline console and provides a link to the execution entity of the external action.

nested_items.name: revisionUrlTemplate
nested_items.description: The URL returned to the CodePipeline console that contains a link to the page where customers can update or change the configuration of the external action.

nested_items.name: actionConfigurationProperties
nested_items.description: The configuration properties for the action type.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the action configuration property.

nested_items.name: required
nested_items.description: Whether the configuration property is a required value.

nested_items.name: key
nested_items.description: Whether the configuration property is a key.

nested_items.name: secret
nested_items.description: Whether the configuration property is secret. Secrets are hidden from all calls except for GetJobDetails, GetThirdPartyJobDetails, PollForJobs, and PollForThirdPartyJobs.

nested_items.name: queryable
nested_items.description: Indicates that the property is used with PollForJobs. When creating a custom action, an action can have up to one queryable property. If it has one, that property must be both required and not secret.

nested_items.name: description
nested_items.description: The description of the action configuration property that is displayed to users.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The type of the configuration property.

nested_items.name: inputArtifactDetails
nested_items.description: The details of the input artifact for the action, such as its commit ID.

nested_items.name: minimumCount
nested_items.description: The minimum number of artifacts allowed for the action type.

nested_items.name: maximumCount
nested_items.description: The maximum number of artifacts allowed for the action type.

nested_items.name: outputArtifactDetails
nested_items.description: The details of the output artifact of the action, such as its commit ID.

nested_items.name: minimumCount
nested_items.description: The minimum number of artifacts allowed for the action type.

nested_items.name: maximumCount
nested_items.description: The maximum number of artifacts allowed for the action type.

nested_items.name: nextToken
nested_items.description: If the amount of returned information is significantly large, an identifier is also returned. It can be used in a subsequent list action types call to return the next set of action types in the list.
